import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.b8f0835e:
df = pd.read_csv("/kaggle/input/videogamesales/vgsales.csv")
top_5_publishers = df["Publisher"].value_counts().head(5)
print(top_5_publishers)
print(f"\n\nThe most common video game publisher is {top_5_publishers.index[0]}.")
source.d6f12d0e:
top_5_platforms = df["Platform"].value_counts().head(5)
print(top_5_platforms)
print(f"\n\nThe most common platform is {top_5_platforms.index[0]}.")
source.9584e9e2:
top_5_genres = df["Genre"].value_counts().head(5)
print(top_5_genres)
print(f"\n\nThe most common genre is {top_5_genres.index[0]}.")
source.3b47f969:
na_sales_median = df["NA_Sales"].median()
print(f"The median of North American video game sales is ${na_sales_median} million.\n\n")

df.loc[df["NA_Sales"] == na_sales_median].head(10)
source.72514fb3:
std = df["NA_Sales"].std()
print(f"The standard deviation above/below the mean for North America is {round(std, 2)}.")
source.a7ead28a:
total_sales_wii = df.loc[df["Platform"] == "Wii"]["Global_Sales"].sum()
print(f"The total sales of Wii platform is {total_sales_wii} millions.")
source.832e48a7:
total_sales_ps2 = df.loc[df["Platform"] == "PS2"]["Global_Sales"].sum()
print(f"The total sales of PS2 platform is {round(total_sales_ps2, 2)} millions.")
source.79d948d7:
total_sales_role_playing = df.loc[df["Genre"] == "Role-Playing"]["Global_Sales"].sum()
print(f"The total sales of role-playing game is {total_sales_role_playing} millions.")
source.eddecb4a:
def test():
    def assert_equal(actual, expected):
        assert actual == expected, f"Expected {expected} but got {actual}"
        
    assert_equal(top_5_publishers.index[0], "Electronic Arts")
    assert_equal(top_5_platforms.index[0], "DS")
    assert_equal(top_5_genres.index[0], "Action")
    assert_equal(na_sales_median, 0.08)
    assert_equal(total_sales_wii, 926.71)
    assert_equal(round(total_sales_ps2, 2), 1255.64)
    assert_equal(total_sales_role_playing, 927.37)
    
    print("Success!!!")
    
test()
